Comments_List: I learned everything any person ever needs to know about galaxy formation, morphology, and evolution, unless that person happens to be an astrophysics major interested in galactic astronomy. Taking this class actually made me feel like an astronomer for the first time in my life.

I thought that the lectures were very well put together, and the problem sets were reflections of what we were learning and made it easier to understand the material. Also, Professor Kenney posts the slides from lectures online, so they make for good study tools. One weakness is that the exams (especially the midterm) are fairly long.

I would recommend this course to any astronomy student that has a strong background in physics and astronomy. Don't jump into this class thinking that ASTR 210 and an introductory physics sequence is enough. It's a graduate-level class and it acts like it. I wouldn't take this class unless you are a junior or senior in physics or astrophysics.
